text: Doña Ana County is a county located in the southern part of the state of New Mexico, in the United States. As of the 2020 census, the population was 219,561. It is the second-most populated county in New Mexico. Its county seat is Las Cruces. The county is named for Doña Ana Robledo, who died there in 1680 while fleeing the Pueblo Revolt. ==References== Category:New Mexico counties Category:1850s establishments in New Mexico Territory Category:1852 establishments in the United States
title: Doña Ana County, New Mexico
